title: Utilities Down as Treasury Yields Rebound — Utilities Roundup
text:
Shares of power producers fell as Treasury yields continued their rebound.

The utility sector was the strongest of the 11 industry group on the Standard & Poor's 500 during the August selloff, as a slide in Treasury yields made the dividend-oriented sector more attractive to yield-hungry investors.

Shares of PG&E rallied after the city of San Francisco offered to buy the utility's electrical lines serving the city for $2.5 billion.

Write to Rob Curran at rob.curran@dowjones.com

(END) Dow Jones Newswires

September 09, 2019 17:07 ET (21:07 GMT)
